Theorem 8.7.1 For a smooth family $f_{s t}:M\to N$ of finite energy maps between Riemannian manifolds,with $f_{s t}(x)=f_{00}(x)$ for all $x\in\partial M$ (in case $\partial M\neq\emptyset$ )andall $s,t$ ,we have for the second variation of energy, with $\begin{array}{r}{V=\frac{\partial f}{\partial s}_{|s=0},W=\frac{\partial f}{\partial t}_{|t=0}}\end{array}$ 
$$
\begin{array}{l}{\displaystyle\frac{\partial^{2}E(f_{s t})}{\partial s\partial t}_{|s=t=0}}\ {=\displaystyle\int_{M}\langle\nabla V,\nabla W\rangle_{f^{-1}T N}-\displaystyle\int_{M}\mathrm{trace}_{M}\langle R^{N}(d f,V)W,d f\rangle_{f^{-1}T N}}\ {+\displaystyle\int_{M}\langle\nabla_{\frac{\partial}{\partial t}}\frac{\partial f}{\partial s},\mathrm{trace}_{M}\nabla d f\rangle_{f^{-1}T N}.}\end{array}
$$
$f_{00}$ is harmom ori $\nabla_{\frac{\partial}{\partial t}}{\frac{\partial f}{\partial s}}\equiv0$ fon $s=t=0$ dependsonly on $V$ $W$ butnot on higher derivatives of $f w.r.t.s,t$ ,and 
$$
\begin{array}{l}{\displaystyle{I_{f}(V,W):=\frac{\partial^{2}E(f_{s t})}{\partial s\partial t}=\int_{M}\langle\nabla V,\nabla W\rangle_{f^{-1}T N}}}\ {\displaystyle{-\int_{M}\mathrm{trace}_{M}\langle R^{N}(d f,V)W,d f\rangle_{f^{-1}T N}}.}\end{array}
$$
